title: @Riot, would you ever partner up with Razer Comms or Curse Voice for the sake of your playerbase?
body:
As first you were against CV because it provided jungle timers. Then you added timers to the game files themselves and re-allowed CV.

Now a lot less people seem use be using CV and Razer Comms and I can't help but feel that this has been caused by confusion as to whether or not we're going to get banned for using it.

I'd really like to see Riot make an announcement on the Main Websites for each Region and perhaps even partner up with CV or Razer Comms and try to get players using it. Voice chat is actively asked for by the playerbase for the sake of better quality communication.

replies.body: I've always wanted voice chat in-game because my internet is too bad to run Skype at the same time as League. However, I don't want it like CoD with how any random in the game can just sit there and flame. Maybe restrict it to people on your friends list? idk, I just feel that voice is needed to communicate effectively sometimes. Yeah pings work fine but you can only communicate to an extent on what is going to happen, and typing takes way too long.
lol it is pretty easy to counter people that flame, it's called a mute button works wonders and is quite simple to use and understand
Yeah I do use it, but I yearn for the day there is no need for it :/

Hey A Blue Quaker

I tried to reply to your post but then I remember Lyte answering to this already on the NA boards so I found his answer and linked it here.
Let me know if this makes sense.

http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4639545&page=1#post48085298

The general statements made in that post is that 1. Riot doesn't want voice chat because it's harder to moderate and could potentially breed toxicity, 2. 3rd party software is fine.

Thing is, though, 3rd party software is useless if nobody knows about it. CV was quite popular for a time, and now nobody uses it because news spread that it would get you banned - and it could for a time. Rito changed their policy when Timers were removed from the app, but they never made  that information widely available but, say, posting a statement on the main page would have been a good solution.

A post from one of the Rioters a while ago on the topic of voice chat involved "no related project for now" and, in case it was to be done, "limited to people on your friendlist".
So while there's no one working on it, they seem to have an idea of some boundaries to apply to eventual future related projects.

Frankly, i'd appreciate if voice chat didn't include randoms. I played HoN.

without mentioning too many games, voice chat is crucial for any online team game in this era (looking at you DOTA and WoW) Crap!

you get my point though ;)
